basics.name: Uday Theja
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary: Working as a Software Developer at Nutanix, Banglore. Graduated in 2019 with a B.Tech and M.Tech in Computer Science & Engineering from IIT Madras.

education.area: B.Tech. & M.Tech. in Computer Science & Engineering

education.institution: Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan Public School, Hyderabad

publications.name: Dyadic Human Interaction Recognition from Videos using Multi-layer 3D CNN
publications.author: Subetha T. , Chitrakala S. and Uday Theja M.
highlights: The proposed DHIR system recognizes the interactions of humans with reduced misclassification rate and minimal processing time compared to the benchmarking datasets for various interactions.
It achieves 94.78% and 93.394% for SBU kinect interaction dataset and AU-Interaction dataset respectively.

publications.name: Fusion-based Gaussian Mixture Model for Background Subtraction from Videos
publications.author: Subetha T. , Chitrakala S. and Uday Theja M.
publications.publisher: International Journal of Computer Applications in Technology (IJCAT), Inderscience
highlights: The proposed FGMM background subtraction algorithm extracts the foreground from videos invariant to illumination, shadows, and the dynamic background by exploiting the Jeffries-Matusita distance, weighted euclidean based color similarity and color distortion measures.
It shows a high recall rate of 97.36% for illumination video sequences.
Nutanix is a cloud computing company that provides hyper-converged infrastructure solutions.
Working in a team led by Dr. Srinivasan Ramasubramanian, responsible for designing and developing networking services like virtual private cloud for customers on the Nutanix public cloud.

Implemented a packet snooping mechanism using pcap to capture the network information dynamically and detect misconfigurations. Enhanced the network controller and implemented a scale limiting mechanism.

As a part of the annual Nutanix hackathon, we developed a software which provides DNS (Domain Name Resolution System) as a service for our on-premises deployments and won the hackathon under the “Hybrid Cloud” category.
Microsoft funded research under the guidance of Dr. C. Krishna Mohan, Professor, CSE department, IIT Hyderabad.
Implemented a communication avoiding fully distributed support vector machine which learns from multiple corpora of sensitive data with different parties without sharing the data to each other.
Implemented distributed parallel algorithms for the existing sequential K-Means++ and GMM algorithms for big data.
Developed web applications capable of chat and voice interaction and a content management system from scratch, for SUSI.AI, an intelligent open source personal assistant.

Auto deployed the server on Google Cloud with Kubernetes such that on every commit pushed to the github repository, using Travis CI, a new docker image is built and the docker hub image and cloud deployment get updated.
Part of the Fraud Decision Science, RIM CoE Team.

Developed a robust prediction system that analyzed the historical FICO scores and forecasted the scores in the future to identify potential defaulters, by using techniques like: ETS, ARIMA, Regression, Neural Networks.
Received a Pre-Placement full-time job offer for the exceptional work.
Worked on an AI powered assistant for enterprise talent lifecycle management.
Developed the backend for email interface, creating and editing calendar events using GMAIL and Nylas APIs.
Created a facebook messenger bot which uses webhooks to reply to a customer.

pors.organization: Programming and Data Structures Lab, CSE Department, IIT Madras
highlights: Being a TA, I got the opportunity to take lectures, conduct tutorial sessions and practically communicate the nitty-gritties of advanced coding to the juniors.
I have also assisted my professor in designing the lab assignments, conducting the examinations and evaluating the submissions.
Exebit is the annual technical fest of CSE Department, IIT Madras.

I was head of the WebOps (Web Operations), leading a team of 7 fellow and junior developers responsible for creating the fest website responsible for displaying events schedule, managing user accounting and registrations.
We developed the end to end website from scratch, deployed it and managed it for the duration of the fest.
Saarang is the annual cultural fest of IIT Madras.

Part of a team of 30, responsible for coordinating the participant registrations, providing accommodation and necessary facilities to ensure a pleasant experience for both the participants and the guests.
Shaastra is the annual technical fest of IIT Madras.
Part of a team of 20, responsible for designing goodies and t-shirts, managing their production and sale, and handling the fest budgeting.
Handling the annual Placement season at IIT Madras, held in December.
I got to interact with a variety of companies, co-ordinate their travel and accommodation, help in conducting the placement tests and facilitate a smooth placement process.

pors.organization: MITR (Mentoring for Individual Transformation), IIT Madras
highlights: MITR is an initiative aimed at guiding and counseling students during their stay at IIT Madras.
MITR also organizes various activities in relation to the orientation of fresh students to IITM life and to spread awareness about the importance of mental health.
Mentor for 7 freshman students.

achievements.title: JEE-Advanced 2014
achievements.summary: Secured All India Rank 334 (99.97 percentile) in JEE-Advanced 2014 (formerly IIT-JEE) examination.

achievements.title: JEE Mains 2014
achievements.summary: Secured All India Rank 58 (99.99 percentile) in JEE-Mains 2014 examination.

achievements.title: EAMCET 2014
achievements.summary: Secured State Rank 137 (99.90 percentile) in EAMCET, Andhra Pradesh Engineering Entrance Test.
